description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eti7f","text":"This protocol describes a 96-well-plate-based, enzymatic assay for reliably estimating ethanol concentrations in experimental samples in one hour. In the presence of excess NAD+, alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH) is employed to convert ethanol to acetaldehyde. The concomitant conversion of NAD+ to NADH is monitored via increased absorbance at 340 nm. When highly accurate analytical techniques (such as high performance liquid chromatography) are not necessary, or are too costly or low-throughput, this assay offers reliable, inexpensive, and rapid detection of ethanol concentrations. This assay is useful for applications such as determining relative ethanol production from microbial fermentations, and detecting ethanol evaporation from media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":176,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":288,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjnvh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c65fn","text":"Version notes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q3p0","text":"10-27-2021. Add 50 ul water to the assay plate first, then add sample. This prevents ethanol evaporation and allows the assay to be started (by adding assay master mix) immediately before reading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aujta","text":"Make ethanol standards at eight concentrations encompassing the range of concentrations expected from the experimental samples, including a 0 g/L ethanol standard. Dilute ethanol in the same media present in the experimental samples to make the standards. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"46dre","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5p0mb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3tu1s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fvule","text":"This protocol was optimized for detecting ethanol concentrations between 0.05 and 1.5 g/L in the assay solution, which corresponds concentrations between 1 and 30 g/L in the experimental samples. Measuring ethanol concentrations outside of this range will require preparing a different standard curve, and making different dilutions of samples (while maintaining 200 μL total volume in each well) to achieve final ethanol concentrations between 0.05 and 1.5 g/L in the assay solution. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2aqrh","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"B_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"}},"colTitles":["Component","Final Concentration","Volume"],"colWidths":["150",100,100],"data":[["NAD stock solution","8 mM","3.2 mL"],["ADH stock solution","0.1 U/mL","111 uL"],["Glycine buffer","---","Up to 20 mL"]],"guid":"BCAD168072D611EBA8C5C5D81BA09900","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["NAD stock solution","8 mM","3.2 mL"],["ADH stock solution","0.1 U/mL","111 uL"],["Glycine buffer","---","Up to 20 mL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aq96s","text":"Turn on the microplate spectrophotometer and open the program (defined in Step 1) to begin heating to  , the temperature at which the assay will be run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":102,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2qgsb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F41689072F411EBA551953B328616CE","id":"48051","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afou5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j567","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1o5q8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pi0r","text":"Designate two of the 12 columns in the 96-well plate for standards, and add 10 μL of each standard with a P10 pipette to the 190 μL of assay master mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lfcd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adq78","text":"In the remaining wells, add 10 μL of each sample. It is recommended to use a multi-channel (8-channel) pipette for this step to fill the plate as rapidly as possible. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bt9mc","text":"Work as quickly as possible through the next three steps (Steps 9 -12) in order to minimize ethanol evaporation and substantial progression of the enzymatic reaction before the microplate program has started. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9mplr","text":"Start the assay by adding 190 μL of the assay master mix using a repeater pipette and a 5 mL repeater pipette tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p812","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3totr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nd31","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"blvvk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9a90e","text":"At this point, the assay has started and the plate should be read as quickly as possible. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fs13d","text":"Seal the plate with a ThermalSeal RTS sealing film. Use a sealing film roller or a roll of tape to ensure that the film is adhered closely to the rim of each well, taking care to avoid any large wrinkles or gaps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"755qg","text":"Place the sealed 96-well plate (without a lid) in the microplate spectrophotometer (preheated to  ) and start the program to read the absorbance at 340 nm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":97,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2p2uh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8e7va","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"79v2s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a53cv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"5B5C8CE072F811EBA551953B328616CE","id":"48052","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":37,"style":"sup"}],"key":"5q20k","text":"As alcohol dehydrogenase converts NAD+ to NADH, absorbance at 340 nm will increase with time. If after 30 minutes, the absorbance at 340 nm plateaus (is no longer increasing) for all of the samples and standards, the program can be terminated. If not, let the program run for the full hour. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mg9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6r1lv","text":"Use the 340 nm absorbance data to calculate Vmax (change in absorbance per unit time) for each well in the plate, including wells containing experimental samples and standards. Use at least 30 data points in a range where absorbance is linearly increasing with time to calculate Vmax. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"em5gi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"orur","text":"Use the standard wells with known ethanol concentrations to generate a standard curve, as specified in the sub-steps below. Sample data is attached.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":148,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9mhvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"10B8DB02344F11EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Sample Data_2021_02_09.xlsx","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/c7dtbifqf.xlsx"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"nkgu","text":"User-defined standard concentrations will serve as x-axis data inputs. Vmax data at 340 nm will serve as y-axis data inputs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4o2ak","text":"Use a four-parameter nonlinear regression curve fit to generate a standard curve with the formula Y = (A-D)/(1+(X/C)^B)+D.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5jdng","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eq765","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"10BBB79F344F11EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":276,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"94qdg\",\"text\":\"A representative standard curve, relating Vmax (mOD/min) at 340 nm, denoted here as Max V [340], and ethanol concentrations (g/L). \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"StdCurve.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ddgwbifqf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ddgubifqf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ddgvbifqf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ddgtbifqf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22gcl","text":"Use the standard curve to calculate ethanol concentrations in the experimental samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"oh0g","text":"Fill all wells of a 96-well plate with 50 μL of water. The purpose of the water is to minimize ethanol evaporation during subsequent sample pipetting steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Enzymatic Ethanol Assay
